name: Marriott Crystal Gateway

reviews.title: Nice place for DC visit
reviews.text: We stayed at the Crystal City Gateway for a long weekend and this was a return trip (although the prior stays were at least 10 years ago). The room was fine...bed was great and it was very quiet. Only noise you could hear from the hall were people talking as they passed by. Our room didn't have refrigerator or nightly turn down service as others have mentioned. The package came with free breakfast and that was a great option. Very nice buffet that ran until 1 pm on the weekends (which was great timing for us) and 10:30 during the week. The garage was very convenient and while $22 is a lot for parking, I think it's in line with the area. My only complaint is about computer access. I hate that they charge $12 something/night to use in the room (while you can use in public areas for free) and that the charge for the PC in the business center was around $7.50 for 15 minutes. I did see a computer/printer behind the concierge for printing boarding passes, but really don't like it when hotels play that game. For me, the location and ease of getting to DC outweighed this challenge and I would stay again.

Our organization held its 25th Annual conference at the Marriott. Proximity to Washington D.C. was important to our agenda. So were the reasonable room rates. With 650 attendees, the facility enabled all travelers to stay here. Ballrooms and meeting rooms were broken down and set up on schedule. Food was good. Staff was very attentive. Wi-Fi was critical to our operation and was reliable at all locations, including sleeping rooms. King bed was better than home. Mini-refrigerator, coffee/tea brewing in room. Maid service was fastidious. Good workout facility on second level open 24 hours was a bonus to hard-working staff and attendees.
reviews.title: Excellent Convention Facility

reviews.text: The extensive underground dining/shopping under Crystal City is...well, really extensive. Be prepared to spend some time once you're down there. Don't forget a map if it's your first time in the underground complex!
reviews.title: Excellent service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location! This hotel is conveniently located to the Metro. Metro stop is located right downstairs, never even have to go outside. The hotel is adjacent to a mall and there are several good restaurants close by. The rooms are nice, thick walls so they are quiet, towels are plush, beds comfortable and they have nightly turn-down service with chocolates on your pillow. They run deals on a regular basis for the weekends, some deals include the breakfast buffet. Buffet choices are extensive, food at the Mez restaurant is very good. The bar makes a lovely Cosmo (they call it something else but whatever the name it is yummy)! However it is the hotel and restaurant staff, that make the experience special. From the front desk to the bellman the staff welcomes you with a smile. When you call for something they are delighted to assist and treat you like they are happy you came to visit.
reviews.title: Nice overnight stay

reviews.text: Had a very nice stay overnight. The room was clean and comfortable. We arrived before noon for check-in and they were able to accomodate us. All of the hotel staff that we interacted with were very helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Great Place for a DC Conference

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The good:
reviews.title: Great hotel, we'll be back!

reviews.text: -The room was nice, clean, spacious, 17th floor with a decent view.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel
Another great stay...
reviews.text: -The staff were very, very nice (especially when hubby called up for room service on the 2nd night, he said they bent over backwards to make sure he was happy with everything).

-The shuttle service was convenient (we didn't have to wait long for it), the location is very convenient (it's right on top of a metro station as others have said - and, like others have said, be sure to get the right hotel out of the two Marriots!).
reviews.title: A nice hotel that's a little pricey.

reviews.text: We paid more than we normally would have done for a hotel, as it was in such close proximity to the Metro and meant we didn't have to hire a car. Not only was it in close proximity, but it was connected to the hotel via tunnels and, in horrible rainy weather - this is a HUGE plus.
reviews.title: Overpriced and Understaffed

reviews.text: I stayed here on business with work colleagues and was very pleased with the hotel. The service was great and there is lots of space in the lobby and other common areas to meet with colleagues. I thought the rate was a little high, but it is DC, afterall.
reviews.title: Very good

reviews.text: My room was very spacious and comfortable - plenty of space to work and relax, and the matress and linens were very good. I would have liked a make-up mirror in the bathroom and a full-length mirror somewhere in the room, but other than that, my room was perfect.
reviews.title: Great location. Terrific staff. Charges from Internet (in the room)

reviews.text: The location is right at the Metro stop - you don't even have to go outside to get from the metro to the hotel lobby - there is an underground shopping area that connects the two. There are also many restaurants within a 10 minute walk of the hotel.
reviews.title: Well priced hotel. Good location

reviews.text: I did not eat in the hotel restaurant, but I got coffee and muffins at the Einsteins in the lobby, which was good - nice people, prompt service, good coffee.
reviews.title: super convenient!

reviews.text: Just returned from DC where we enjoyed the Cherry Blossoms. Beautiful!! In researching a place to stay I wanted something close to the airport and the Metro. The Crystal City metro station is the first stop on the blue line when leaving the airport (DCA). The metro station and hotel are linked via an underground walkway making it unnecessary to go outside. As a note of caution (since we first went to the wrong Marriott), let me add that there are two Marriott's at the Crystal City metro station. To reach the Marriott Gateway (the one on which this review is based) TURN RIGHT when you exit the Metro area, before you go outside. If you turn left, you'll go to the other Marriott.) The beds were super comfortable. The rooms were quiet. We had adjoining rooms with one of the rooms being a mini-suite (living room and bedroom areas separate) and the other being more of the typical hotel room. The only disappointment with the hotel is the charge for Internet ($12.95 plus tax for 24 hours). Also, the elevators seemed to be much slower than other hotels at which I've stayed. The Crystal City shops are very near (close to the metro station) with a variety of eating and shopping places. All in all we had a great experience. I would definitely stay at this hotel again
reviews.title: Great property, excellent location - all's well unless you need to use an elevator!

reviews.text: This hotel was clean and updated. Rooms were very comfortable...loved the beds! Location was great...with access to the Crystal City Shops and the Metro. Customer service was excellent! Would come back again.
reviews.title: Really nice hotel at a reasonable price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Sheraton across the street use to be our hotel of choice when we visit friends in Crystal City. But this time the Sheraton's rate was too high, so we went with the Marriott. Really glad we did. From now on, we'll be staying at the Marriott. First it's bigger than the Sheraton with much more choices. There are a couple of different restaurants in the hotel and there's also an Einstein's Bagel, should you decide to get something to go.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: We also got a great rate that included breakfast and the internet. We really enjoyed the breakfast buffet - the fresh fruits were amazingly sweet. Will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Excellence amidst the chaos

reviews.text: Recently, my husband and I had a business trip to Washington D.C. and stayed out from the city a bit at the Marriott Crystal Gateway ( there are two Marriots in close proximity; this one is located on Jefferson Davis Highway.) This hotel has almost immediate access to the Metro and the Crystal City transport, and down the entrance to the Metro are shops, a convenient little pharmacy/supply store, as well as a food buffet area that serves an amazing array of breakfast items, lunch offerings, and substantial dinner entrees. There is seating nearby for customers relax while they eat. Thus the hotel is situated with many pleasant patron conveniences.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.text: In addition, for a very large hotel with lots of meetings, conventions etc.--some simultaneous--they offer free hotel to airport shuttles every 20 minutes, and the concierge services there led us to several great restaurants--some within walking distance--and pleasant tours ( especially one out to Mount Vernon.) The tour buses picked us up right outside the hotel.
reviews.title: OK IF they honor your confirmed reservation

description: The Crystal Gateway Marriott offers an ideal location for vacations, business trips and weekend getaways. We are only one mile from Reagan National Airport and provide complimentary shuttle service to and from for our guests.The Crystal City underground can be accessed from our lobby offering direct access to the Metro system and a multitude of restaurants and shopping. Guests can also take advantage of complimentary WiFi in our lobby and multiple dining options within the hotel including Einstein Bagels. We're also minutes from the sites and sounds of Georgetown, Old Town Alexandria and unbelievable shopping at The Fashion Centre at Pentagon City. Our hotel provides 34,300 sq. ft. of meeting space and 27 meeting rooms with an on-site business center and Hertz rental desk.
